actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to provide for a national educational campaign to combat the lack of consciousness of the public as to the danger of improper uses of motor vehicles on the highways, and to impose an additional tax of one-tenth of a cent per gallon on gasoline and other motor fuels to pay for the costs of such campaign.

summary.text: Directs the Secretary of Transportation to carry on a national education campaign designed to educate drivers and pedestrians as to the danger of driving on or crossing the highways. Imposes an additional tax of one-tenth of one percent per gallon on gasoline and other motor fuels to pay for the costs of such campaign.

titles.title: A bill to provide for a national educational campaign to combat the lack of consciousness of the public as to the danger of improper uses of motor vehicles on the highways, and to impose an additional tax of one-tenth of a cent per gallon on gasoline and other motor fuels to pay for the costs of such campaign.
